周三，在不到一周的第二轮示威活动中，肯尼亚各城市的抗议者与警察发生冲突，主要反对派领导人呼吁反对一系列增税。

据路透社记者和肯尼亚电视台播放的视频报道，在首都内罗毕、港口城市蒙巴萨和其他几个城镇，警察发射催泪瓦斯驱散抗议者。

“我们是自愿冒险出去的，”内罗毕基贝拉非正式定居点的抗议者易卜拉欣·斯坦利说。 “我们来这里是因为我们累了。”

连接内罗毕和主要机场的高速公路上发生了激烈冲突，抗议者点燃篝火并推倒围栏。该高速公路表示，三个车站的收费服务已停止。

上周五，在反对税收的抗议活动中，至少有六人被杀，这些税收包含在总统威廉·鲁托上个月签署成为法律的财政法案中。

肯尼亚高等法院下令暂停执行该立法，等待法律挑战，但政府还是提高了汽油价格。

一位发言人表示，呼吁抗议的反对党领袖拉伊拉·奥廷加将于周三晚些时候在内罗毕向支持者发表讲话。奥廷加在过去五次总统选举中获得亚军，包括去年输给鲁托。

今年早些时候，奥廷加领导了一系列针对高生活成本和涉嫌选举违规行为的抗议活动，示威活动一再演变成骚乱。这促使民间领袖警告不要再次陷入过去困扰肯尼亚的种族暴力事件。

鲁托政府表示，增税措施包括将燃油税加倍和征收经济适用房税，每年将额外筹集 2000 亿肯尼亚先令（14.2 亿美元），以应对不断增长的债务偿还和资助创造就业的举措。

反对派表示，他们将加深肯尼亚人的苦难，而此时许多人已经在为玉米粉等基本商品的高价格而苦苦挣扎。 （1 美元 = 141.2000 肯尼亚先令）

Thomas Mukoya、Jefferson Kahinju 和 Humphrey Malalo 报道 Aaron Ross 撰稿 Alex Richardson 和 Peter Graff 编辑; Wed, 12 Jul 2023 11:24:42 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/kenyan-police-deploy-capital-ahead-expected-protests-over-tax-hikes-2023-07-12/ https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/kenyan-police-deploy-capital-ahead-expected-protests-over-tax-hikes-2023-07-12/Reuters肯尼亚政治/（更新 1、PIX、电视） Factbox: Spurned a NATO invitation, Ukraine still reaps rewards at summit

北约领导人在本周于维尔纽斯举行的峰会上表示，乌克兰应该能够在未来某个时候加入该军事联盟，但基辅立即发出邀请的希望落空了。

关于乌克兰加入北约之路的谨慎声明激怒了总统弗拉基米尔·泽连斯基。但自俄罗斯发起所谓的特别军事行动以来，经过16个月的战争，俄罗斯仍有望在峰会结束时获得一些切实的回报。

以下是在峰会上向乌克兰做出的一些主要承诺。

没有邀请......但障碍已消除

虽然北约没有立即发出邀请，但它确实放弃了对乌克兰履行所谓的成员行动计划（MAP）的要求，有效地消除了基辅加入联盟的障碍。

新一届北约-乌克兰理事会的第一次会议也在周三举行，这是一种旨在加强基辅与 31 国联盟之间合作的新形式。北约国家在一份声明中还承诺“只要需要”就会支持乌克兰。

安全保证

官员们表示，七国集团国家将宣布一项国际框架，为乌克兰的长期安全保证铺平道路，以加强其对俄罗斯的防御并阻止莫斯科未来的侵略。

法国导弹

法国将与英国一起向乌克兰提供远程巡航导弹，射程可达250公里（155英里），此举使乌克兰军队能够打击俄罗斯军队并深入前线后方补给。

一位法国军方消息人士告诉记者，这些导弹将来自法国现有的军事库存，并补充说这将是一个“相当大的数字”。

英国车辆和弹药

英国表示将向乌克兰提供70多辆战斗和后勤车辆、数千发挑战者2坦克弹药以及价值5000万英镑（6500万美元）的设备维修支持包。

英国还将通过北约发起一个项目，为乌克兰士兵建立一个医疗康复中心。

F-16 训练

由 11 个国家组成的联盟将于 8 月在丹麦开始训练乌克兰飞行员驾驶 F-16 战斗机，并将在罗马尼亚设立一个训练中心。

虽然尚未确定，但如果就战斗机的供应达成一致，培训计划将使乌克兰飞行员和服务人员能够在明年初之前使用 F-16 进行战斗。

德国爱国者队

德国政府敲定了对乌克兰的 7 亿欧元（7.7 亿美元） 军事援助计划，其中包括德国联邦国防军库存的两辆爱国者发射器、另外 40 辆马德步兵战车以及额外的主战坦克和弹药。

挪威支持

挪威今年将对乌克兰的军事支持增加25亿克朗（2.39亿美元），达到100亿。

多年计划

该联盟同意进一步发展综合援助一揽子计划（CAP），根据该计划，乌克兰目前已承诺提供 5 亿欧元的非致命援助， 并将其发展为一项多年期计划。

Niklas Pollard、John Irish、Sabine Siebold、Andrew Gray 和 Justyna Pawlak 报道；亚历克斯·理查森编辑; Wed, 12 Jul 2023 10:29:59 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/spurned-nato-invitation-ukraine-still-reaps-rewards-summit-2023-07-12/ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/spurned-nato-invitation-ukraine-still-reaps-rewards-summit-2023-07-12/Reuters北约峰会/乌克兰承诺（资料箱） Hollywood studios racing to avoid actors' strike at midnight

周三，好莱坞主要电影和电视制片厂以及代表 16 万名演员的工会在午夜截止日期之前进行了最后的谈判，试图避免娱乐业发生第二次罢工。

好莱坞最大的工会 SAG-AFTRA 要求在流媒体电视时代获得更高的补偿，并要求围绕人工智能 (AI) 的使用提供保障。如果谈判代表无法达成协议，议员们已授权罢工，詹妮弗·劳伦斯和梅丽尔·斯特里普等一线明星也表示，他们准备辞职。

他们将加入美国作家协会 (WGA) 约 11,500 名成员的行列，该协会于 5 月初举行了罢工。这次罢工导致深夜电视脱口秀节目无休无止地重播，并扰乱了秋季电视季的大部分制作和一些大预算电影的拍摄。

SAG-AFTRA 的罢工将迫使更多片场关闭，给电影制片厂带来压力，要求找到解决方案。

周二晚些时候，SAG-AFRA 谈判代表同意了制片厂传唤联邦调解员的请求。但工会表示，工作室代表“滥用了我们的信任”，向媒体泄密，并且在周三晚间的最后期限后，工会不会做出让步。

自 1960 年以来，好莱坞还没有面临过双重罢工，当时 WGA 和演员工会的成员因争夺出售给电视网络的电影剩余物而呼吁停工。

如今，工会正在与 Netflix (NFLX.O) 、华特迪士尼(DIS.N)和其他公司就基本工资和流媒体服务剩余费用以及包括生成人工智能的使用在内的其他问题展开斗争。演员们希望得到保证，他们的数字图像在未经他们许可的情况下不会被使用。

对于媒体公司来说，谈判是在困难时期进行的，这些公司花费了数十亿美元进行节目制作，试图吸引新的流媒体客户。

迪士尼、康卡斯特公司(CMCSA.O)旗下的 NBCUniversal 和派拉蒙全球(PARA.O)在最近一个季度的流媒体业务中各损失了数亿美元。与此同时，随着传统电视观众的减少，在线视频的兴起侵蚀了电视广告收入。

代表电影公司进行谈判的电影电视制片人联盟 (AMPTP) 拒绝就其与 SAG-AFTRA 的谈判发表评论。

AMPTP 表示已向编剧们提供“慷慨”的加薪，但无法同意编剧们的所有要求。自 5 月 2 日编剧罢工开始以来，制片厂和 WGA 尚未举行过会谈。

丽莎·里奇维恩报道；比尔·伯克罗特编辑; Wed, 12 Jul 2023 10:12:39 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/us/hollywood-studios-racing-avoid-actors-strike-midnight-2023-07-12/ https://www.reuters.com/world/us/hollywood-studios-racing-avoid-actors-strike-midnight-2023-07-12/Lisa Richwine电视演员/（PIX） Russian hackers lured embassy workers in Ukraine with ad for a cheap BMW

一家网络安全公司周三发布的报告称，涉嫌为俄罗斯外国情报机构工作的黑客利用虚假二手车广告针对驻乌克兰大使馆的数十名外交官，试图侵入他们的计算机。

Palo Alto Networks 的 Unit 42 研究部门的分析师在报告中表示，这种范围广泛的间谍活动针对的是在乌克兰首都基辅大约 80 个外国使团中至少 22 个工作的外交官。

这份由路透社首先报道的报告称：“这场活动始于一场无害且合法的活动。”

“2023 年 4 月中旬，波兰外交部的一名外交官通过电子邮件向各个大使馆发送了一份合法传单，宣传出售位于基辅的二手 BMW 5 系列轿车”。

这位出于安全考虑而拒绝透露姓名的波兰外交官证实了他的广告在数字入侵中所扮演的角色。

Unit 42 表示，这些被称为 APT29 或“Cozy Bear”的黑客拦截并复制了该传单，将其嵌入恶意软件，然后将其发送给在基辅工作的其他数十名外国外交官。

报告称：“对于通常范围狭窄且秘密的高级持续威胁（APT）行动来说，其范围令人震惊。”该报告使用了经常用于描述国家支持的网络间谍组织的缩写词。

2021 年， 美国和英国情报机构认定 APT29 是俄罗斯对外情报局 SVR 的一个部门。 SVR 没有回应路透社就黑客活动发表评论的请求。

4 月，波兰反情报和网络安全当局警告称，该组织针对北约成员国、欧盟和非洲开展了“广泛的情报活动”。

Unit 42 的研究人员能够将虚假汽车广告与 SVR 联系起来，因为黑客重复使用了之前与间谍机构相关的某些工具和技术。

“外交任务永远是高价值的间谍目标，”Unit 42 报告称。 “俄罗斯入侵乌克兰十六个月后，围绕乌克兰的情报和盟国的外交努力几乎肯定是俄罗斯政府的高度优先事项”。

二手宝马

这位波兰外交官表示，他已将原始广告发送给基辅的各个大使馆，有人给他回了电话，因为价格看起来“有吸引力”。

这位外交官告诉路透社：“当我检查时，我意识到他们正在谈论略低的价格。”

事实证明，SVR 黑客在虚假广告中以较低价格（7,500 欧元）列出了外交官的宝马，试图鼓励更多人下载恶意软件，从而远程访问其设备。成立。

Unit 42 称，该软件被伪装成二手宝马的相册。报告称，试图打开这些照片会感染目标的机器。

路透社随后联系了黑客针对的 22 个大使馆，其中有 21 个没有发表评论。目前尚不清楚哪些大使馆（如果有的话）受到了损害。

美国国务院发言人表示，他们“已了解该活动，并且根据网络与技术安全局的分析发现，该活动并未影响国务院系统或账户”。

这位波兰外交官告诉路透社，至于汽车，它仍然可用：

“我可能会尝试在波兰出售它，”他说。 “经历了这种情况，我不想再遇到任何问题了”。

詹姆斯·皮尔森的报道；康纳·汉弗莱斯编辑; Wed, 12 Jul 2023 10:11:57 GMT https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russian-hackers-lured-embassy-workers-ukraine-with-an-ad-cheap-bmw-2023-07-12/ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russian-hackers-lured-embassy-workers-ukraine-with-an-ad-cheap-bmw-2023-07-12/James Pearson乌克兰危机/网络俄罗斯（更新 1，独家，PIX） Double blow for Thailand's Pita as legal cases mount on eve of PM voteSummary:
  • 对股票和君主制的投诉受到关注
  • 亲民主团体呼吁抗议
  • 皮塔质疑针对他采取行动的时机
  • “前进”议程被视为对保守派的威胁

泰国总理候选人皮塔·林贾伦拉 (Pita Limjaroenrat) 周三遭遇重大挫折，针对他的两起独立投诉愈演愈烈，有可能在对总理职位进行关键投票前夕破坏他的领导权竞选。

皮塔的支持者，其中许多是反对保皇党军队介入政治的年轻选民，周三晚些时候呼吁举行抗议，这增加了二十年来难以驾驭的泰国政坛出现新一轮动荡的可能性。

宪法法院表示，它已经接受了一名律师针对皮塔及其赢得选举的前进党提出的申诉，称该党计划改革一项禁止王室侮辱的法律，相当于企图“推翻以国王为首的民主政府政权”。国家元首”。

就在几小时前，选举委员会建议同一法院取消皮塔的立法者资格，称其认为指控他没有资格参加 5 月 14 日大选的投诉是有道理的，因为他拥有一家媒体公司的股份违反选举规则。

没有立即迹象表明任何事态发展都会阻止 42 岁的皮塔参加周四的投票，他面临着赢得立法机构半数以上所需支持的挑战。

为了在议会中获得足够的支持以成为总理，皮塔似乎必须赢得参议院中反对本党反建制议程的保守派成员的支持，其中最具争议的内容是修改刑法第 112 条，该条惩罚侮辱他人的行为。最高可判处15年监禁。

皮塔表示，选举委员会取消他资格的建议是不公平的，他对时机提出质疑。

他对记者说：“这有点仓促，在总理投票前一天，这不应该发生。”

在法院宣布新案时，皮塔在接受电视采访时强调，他的政党修改第112条的提议并不是试图破坏君主制。

受到年轻选民对其大胆改革计划的大力支持，前进党和另一个反对党在 5 月的选举中击败了与保皇党军队结盟的竞争对手，人们普遍认为这是对由保守派领导或支持的九年政府的压倒性公开拒绝。军队。

前进党以 10 个席位击败了原本预计获胜的民粹主义为泰党，两党希望在周四的投票后共同组建联合政府。

“战斗已经开始”

这些法庭案件是泰国长达二十年的动荡权力斗争的最新转折，这场斗争广泛地使与保皇党军队和有影响力的老钱家族结盟的保守派与民粹主义或进步主义平台上选出的政党展开对立。

学生领导的抗议运动领导人呼吁改革《宪法》第 112 条，并举行大规模集会反对即将卸任的军方支持的政府，敦促其支持者周三晚些时候在包括曼谷在内的至少五个城市走上街头。

抗议领袖阿农·南帕在推特上发布的手写便条中表示：“必须对破坏民主的行为进行报复。”

“无论结果如何，让所有人知道战斗已经开始。”

皮塔是一位在美国接受教育的网约车应用程序 Grab (GRAB.O)的前高管，他得到了一个八党联盟的支持，该联盟控制着议会下院的 312 个席位。

预计他周四将在无人反对的情况下参选，但仍需要 64 张选票，无论是来自下议院的敌对政党还是军政府指定的参议院，这一挑战现在可能更加困难。

另一个挫折是，民主党政治家 Chaichana Dechdecho 告诉路透社，该党的 25 名议员不会在周四的投票中支持皮塔，因为该党计划修改第 112 号法案。

参议员杰顿·西拉特拉农 (Jetn Sirathranon) 告诉路透社，委员会建议取消皮塔资格，这将削弱对他的支持。

“泰国总理必须有尊严、不玷污，”他说。

瑞典焚烧《古兰经》事件后，联合国人权理事会周三批准了一项关于宗教仇恨的有争议的决议，引起西方国家的担忧，称该决议挑战了长期以来的人权保护做法。

该决议由巴基斯坦代表 57 个国家的伊斯兰合作组织 (OIC) 提出，呼吁联合国人权事务主管发布一份关于宗教仇恨的报告，并要求各国审查其法律并填补可能“妨碍预防宗教仇恨”的漏洞。以及起诉和鼓吹宗教仇恨的行为。”

美国和欧盟强烈反对，称这与他们的人权和言论自由观相冲突。他们在谴责焚烧《古兰经》的同时，认为伊斯兰会议组织的倡议旨在保护宗教象征而不是人权。

上个月，一名前往瑞典的伊拉克移民在斯德哥尔摩一座清真寺外焚烧了《古兰经》 ，引发了穆斯林世界的愤怒，并要求穆斯林国家采取行动。

这次投票的结果标志着西方国家的重大失败，而伊斯兰会议组织在理事会中拥有前所未有的影响力，而理事会是唯一由政府组成的保护全世界人权的机构。

28个国家投了赞成票，12个国家投了反对票，7个国家弃权。决议通过后，一些国家代表鼓掌。

总部位于日内瓦的普遍权利组织主任马克·利蒙表示，这一结果表明“西方在人权理事会上全面撤退”。

“他们越来越失去支持并失去争论，”他说。

美国常驻联合国人权理事会代表米歇尔·泰勒表示，美国对该倡议的担忧“没有得到认真对待”。

她说：“我相信，如果有更多的时间和更公开的讨论，我们也可以找到共同推进这项决议的方法。”

投票结束后，巴基斯坦常驻联合国日内瓦办事处代表哈利勒·哈斯米指责西方国家“口头上”履行了防止宗教仇恨的承诺。

“房间里一些人的反对源于他们不愿意谴责公开亵渎《古兰经》或任何其他宗教书籍的行为，”他说。

“他们缺乏政治、法律和道德勇气来谴责这一行为，这是安理会对他们的最低期望。”

周三，朝鲜在其东海岸发射了一枚疑似洲际弹道导弹（ICBM），当时韩国和日本领导人将在北约峰会期间会面，讨论包括拥有核武器的朝鲜在内的威胁。

此次发射是在朝鲜最近几天强烈抱怨之后进行的，朝鲜指责美国间谍机侵犯其经济区领空， 谴责美国核动力巡航导弹潜艇最近访问韩国，并承诺采取措施作出反应。

日本内阁官房长官松野博和表示，这枚疑似洲际弹道导弹飞行了 74 分钟，高度为 6,000 公里（3,728 英里），射程为 1,000 公里，这将是朝鲜导弹有史以来最长的飞行时间。

日本海岸警卫队曾预测导弹将落在朝鲜半岛以东约 550 公里（340 英里）处。

In April, North Korea test fired its first ever solid-fuel ICBM, one of around a dozen missile tests this year. Analysts believe the North's ICBMs can fly far enough to strike targets anywhere in the United States, and the country likely has developed nuclear warheads that can fit on rockets.

"It could be a second test of the solid-fuel Hwasong-18 ICBM, building on the results of its first launch," said Kim Dong-yup, a professor at the University of North Korean Studies in Seoul.

Yang Uk, a fellow at the Asan Institute for Policy Studies, said the latest test could be part of the North's efforts to save face and retake the initiative after a failed launch of its first-ever spy satellite in May.

Pyongyang's accusations of US airspace breaches this week, which Washington and Seoul dismissed as groundless, were likely to build justification for the launch, Yang said.

DIPLOMACY AT NATO

Leif-Eric Easley, an international studies professor at Ewha Womans University in Seoul, said North Korea was following a pattern of staging weapons tests in time for diplomatic events, such as the planned South Korea-Japan talks.

South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, in Lithuania for the NATO summit, convened an emergency national security council meeting to discuss the launch and vowed to use the summit to call for strong international solidarity to confront such threats.

Yoon, at a meeting with Japan, Australia and New Zealand, said the North's launch posed a direct challenge to peace in the region and the world, and to the norms-based order.

"We cannot condone these provocations, and we must respond to North Korea's reckless actions through strong responses and solidarity of the international community," Yoon said, according to his office.

Japan's Matsuno said the launch threatened regional and international peace and stability, and that Japan had lodged a protest through diplomatic channels in Beijing.

Yoon is expected to discuss ways to boost joint responses to North Korean threats at separate talks with Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida later on Wednesday.

With a wary eye on North Korea's military moves and other rising challenges in the region, Yoon has moved to repair frayed ties with Japan and reduce historical disputes that have limited cooperation between the two US allies.

Nuclear envoys of South Korea, the US and Japan held a phone call on Wednesday to strongly condemn the North's missile launch as a serious provocation that can "never be justified," Seoul's foreign ministry said. They also criticised Pyongyang's recent threats against what they described as the allies' normal flight activity in international waters.

The three countries' top military generals gathered for a rare trilateral meeting in Hawaii just before the missile launch.

China's major tech companies have shed more than $1 trillion in value -equivalent to the entire Dutch economy - since the government's regulatory crackdown on the sector began more than two years ago, according to Refinitiv data.

Investors are now hoping the strict rules that have stymied growth since late 2020 will start to ease, after the People's Bank of China (PBOC) indicated a change in direction could be under way.

The central bank said on Friday most of the main problems for platform companies' financial businesses had been rectified, and regulators would shift their focus to the industry as a whole rather than specific companies.

The state planner on Wednesday praised Tencent Holdings, the world's largest video game company (0700.HK) , and e-commerce titan Alibaba Group (9988.HK) , for their contributions to China's tech innovation, in another sign that authorities are warming to the technology sector once more.

Analysts pinpoint the shelving of Alibaba affiliate Ant Group's $37 billion initial public offering (IPO) in November 2020 as the start of a sweeping regulatory crackdown on mainland China's tech firms, which had grown rapidly in size and influence.

Since then, roughly $1.1 trillion has been wiped from the market capitalisation of the Hong Kong-listed stock of Alibaba Group, Tencent, Chinese food delivery giant Meituan (3690.HK) , search engine provider Baidu Inc (9888.HK) and e-commerce site JD.com (9618.HK) .

Share prices for the five companies have plunged between 40.4% and 71% during that time.

Technology stocks (.HSTECH) in Hong Kong have rallied 4.1% since Monday as investors bank on an easing regulatory environment to boost earnings, but some analysts have sounded a note of caution.

"Mega-cap tech companies will allocate increasingly large amounts of capital expenditure towards developing generative AI technologies and products in a hostile external environment, potentially impacting profitability," said Redmond Wong, Saxo Markets strategist in Hong Kong.

Steven Leung, UOB Kay Hian sales director, said current valuations would last "until we see more supporting policies from authorities".

Reporting by Donny Kwok in Hong Kong and Scott Murdoch in Sydney; Editing by Kevin Liffey ; Wed, 12 Jul 2023 08:31:45 GMT https://www.reuters.com/technology/beijings-regulatory-crackdown-wipes-11-trln-off-chinese-big-tech-2023-07-12/ https://www.reuters.com/technology/beijings-regulatory-crackdown-wipes-11-trln-off-chinese-big-tech-2023-07-12/Donny Kwok, Scott Murdoch中国ANT/ Exclusive: Russia is rotting in absurdity and repression, veteran rights campaigner says

Russia is decaying in a potent brew of absurdity and repression that is comparable to the Leonid Brezhnev-era of the Soviet Union, Oleg Orlov, one of the Russia's most respected human rights campaigners, told Reuters.

Orlov, 70, is on trial in Russia for articles he published last year which cast Russia as a "fascist" state seeking revenge for the perceived humiliations of the 1991 collapse of the Soviet Union. He faces up to three years in prison.

One of the leaders of the Memorial rights group, which won a share of the Nobel Peace Prize in 2022 a year after being banned and dissolved in Russia, Orlov stood by his articles and cast Russia as a country gripped by the demons of history.

"Russia is going backwards," Orlov told Reuters in his Moscow flat over a glass of the traditional fermented kvas. "We left Communist totalitarianism but now have returned to a different kind of totalitarianism. I call it fascism."

"What is happening in Russia right now is absurd," he said when asked about the failed June 24 mutiny by Wagner mercenaries and the apparent absence of punishment given to the mutineers while he was prosecuted for publishing an article.

Russia's future, he said, would be decided on the battlefield in Ukraine, though he expressed regrets that Russia had missed a historic chance to occupy its place among the powers of the 21st Century.

"If this regime persists for a long time, then Russia will face a long, slow decay, lagging behind the whole world," Orlov said. "Russia has already been thrown somewhere out of the 21st Century, not even into the 20th but into the 19th Century."

Orlov, a biologist who as a Soviet dissident sought to shed light on the 1979-1989 war in Afghanistan and the rise of Poland's Solidarity movement, said he did not believe in revolution but that if Putin's successors were from his entourage there would never be true reform.

"Mostly likely what awaits Russia is a slow rot," he said, adding that Russia had missed a major opportunity to reform as the Cold War ended.

'MAN OF WAR'

He said that the early 1990s were a period of intense struggle and hardship for the Russian people, but he remembered the years as "a time of change and hope and opportunity".

The hopes of what he called the revolution of 1991 began to unravel, he said, during the First Chechen War (1994-1996) and then after Vladimir Putin's rise to the top job in 1999 amid the Second Chechen War (1999-2009).

"For Putin, war is his political technology," Orlov said. "Putin is a man of war."

Current Russian levels of repression, he said, could be compared to the Brezhnev era of the Soviet Union after the arrest of writers Andrei Sinyavsky and Yuli Daniel in 1965.

"This is the Brezhnev period," Orlov said. "The state intervenes in everything: not only in politics, not only in public activity, not only is the economy entirely subordinate to the state, but also culture and even private life."

Putin has repeatedly cast himself as a Russian leader who brought an end to the tumult of the 1990s and started standing up to an arrogant West which he says dismissed Russian interests and has repeatedly plotted to split up Russia.

Supporters of Putin dismiss campaigners such as Orlov as unpatriotic Soviet-era dissidents who are in the pocket of the West and who fail to grasp the trauma of the Soviet collapse which was mired by corruption, poverty and decay.

When asked about such a critique, Orlov said: "If they think that I and my like-minded people do not represent anyone, then why is such the huge machine of the state aimed at our suppression?"

Asked whether his criticism was unpatriotic, Orlov, citing Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's "Gulag Archipelago", pointed out that military defeats have played a significant role in driving reform and development Russian history.

"I know that I will not be acquitted," Orlov said of his trial. "But what option do I have: Should I ask for forgiveness, weep and promise never to do it again? I will not do that."

He showed Reuters the pro-war graffiti that was sprawled on the front door of his flat, including a giant "Z" - a symbol of the war.

So what will a 70-year-old do if he is sent to a Russian prison?

"I will sit and try to survive in very difficult conditions," Orlov said. Asked what he might read, he said that he would read some William Faulkner and certainly Fyodor Dostoevsky's "The Brothers Karamazov".
